source.author: Barker, W.R.
source.title: Scrophulariaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Barker, W.R. (1999). Scrophulariaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Anther connectives surrounded by usually dense (but sometimes sparse) hairs; corollas white to deep lilac or purple, with purple striations on tube and hood only or striations completely absent
Anther connectives without (or with only a few) surrounding hairs; corollas white, with purple striations in tube and hood, often extending onto lobes, or striations sometimes lacking
Glandular hairs absent except on corolla; corollas white to deep lilac or purple
Glandular hairs present on lower parts of branches and lower leaves, sometimes extending to the bracts and calyces; corolla pale to deep lilac or purple
